step_by_step_thinking: The patient presents with sepsis signs, pelvic inflammatory disease, and DIC. The phenol test identifies a phosphorylated N-acetylglucosamine dimer with fatty acids, characteristic of Neisseria species. Neisseria gonorrhoeae is a gram-negative coccobacillus causing pelvic infections, with grey colonies on charcoal blood agar. Other options do not match the test result or clinical context.
